description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Economic And Social Policy General, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Vulnerable groups, in particular children and women, benefit from improved social protection systems guided by generated evidence.

participating-org.narrative: FEDERACAO DAS ONGS EM SAO TOME E PRINCIPE
MINISTERIO DO TRABALHO SOLIDARIEDAD FAMILIA E PROTECAO SOCIAL
SECRETARIA REGIONAL PARA ASSUNTOS SOCIAIS E INSTITUCIONAIS
STEP UP SAO TOME E PRINCIPE UNION F PROMOTION

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)
Linking cash to other programs, information and services (information on essential family practices, livelihoods, psycho-social support, etc.)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C - domestic revenue mobilization and access to finance for key social services
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Shock responsive social protection - Strengthening social protection system for humanitarian response (preparedness)
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development

title.narrative: Sao Tome and Principe United Nations Development Assistance Framework
Sao Tome and Principe Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change
UNICEF Programmes in Sao Tome & Principe
Sao Tome and Principe Country Programme Document 2017-2021
Sao Tome and Principe Country Programme Document 2017-2022 extension 1
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Sao Tome and Principe 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: During 2019 UNICEF continued to collaborate with the government in the area of Social Protection. Thanks to UNICEF's continued efforts and advocacy at the highest level, the First National Social Welfare Council was successfully completed. During the Council, emphasis was placed on coordination between the different actors, to achieve synergy of interventions, on institutional capacity building for the improvement of the staff framework and on the functioning of the Council. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/01/2020

title.narrative: Social welfare workforce strengthened and connected to social protection system (case management, referral capacity development)
Child and gender sensitive national social protection costed annual action plans are in place and dully followed
National social cash transfer programmes are monitored and yearly reviewed based on monitoring results
Coordination: Coordination mechanisms for social protection systems established countrywide
